executive_summary: Somnath Kshirsagar is a 43-year-old male with Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus (T1DM) diagnosed in 2022. His current HbA1c is 8.3%, indicating a need for improved glycemic control, alongside monitoring of cardiovascular risk factors.

recent_events: 1 hypoglycemic event in the last 90 days

interpretation.assessment: Current HbA1c is above the target for T1DM, indicating a need for medication adjustment and lifestyle changes.
interpretation.plan: Consider starting insulin therapy or adjusting current regimen.

interpretation.assessment: LDL levels are above the recommended target, increasing cardiovascular risk.
interpretation.plan: Discuss dietary changes and consider statin therapy.

interpretation.assessment: Patient is overweight, which may contribute to insulin resistance.
interpretation.plan: Implement lifestyle interventions focused on weight loss.

lifestyle_plan.text: Increase physical activity to at least 150 minutes of moderate exercise per week.
Aim for a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins.

diet_plan.principles: Focus on low glycemic index foods, reduce saturated fats, and limit sugar intake.
sample_meals: Grilled chicken salad with a variety of vegetables
Quinoa with mixed vegetables and a source of protein
Oatmeal topped with berries and nuts
diet_plan.portion_guidance: Use portion control to manage calorie intake, aiming for smaller, more frequent meals.

monitoring_plan.glucose_targets: Aim for pre-meal glucose levels of 4-7 mmol/L.
monitoring_plan.testing_frequency: Test blood glucose levels at least 4 times a day.
monitoring_plan.safety_checks: Regularly check for signs of hypoglycemia and ketones.

patient_goals: Reduce LDL to < 2.0 mmol/L within 6 months

medication_plan.text: Consider starting insulin therapy to improve glycemic control.
Discuss the initiation of statin therapy for LDL management.

follow_up.actions: Reassess HbA1c, lipid levels, and weight.
Review lifestyle changes and medication adherence.

emr_note: Patient with T1DM presents with elevated HbA1c at 8.3%. Initiate discussion on insulin therapy and lifestyle modifications. Monitor lipid levels and weight.
